alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 12:45PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...PROLONGED RAINFALL FOR THE KENAI PENINSULA, ANCHORAGE, MATANUSKA AND SUSITNA VALLEY... A rainy weather regime continues across much of Southcentral. Southwesterly flow from the Kenai Peninsula through Cook Inlet to the Anchorage and Matanuska and Susitna Valleys is bringing prolonged, steady rainfall, which is expected to linger through at least Sunday morning and perhaps into the latter half of the day. Storm total precipitation is forecast to be greatest for communities along Cook Inlet, such as Nikiski, Kenai, Soldotna and also north into the Susitna Valley, such as Talkeetna and Skwentna, northward. High confidence exists for totals greater than one inch. There is lower confidence for rainfall totals exceeding two inches and also for the overall rainfall totals in locations that reside closer to the Chugach and Kenai Mountains. Southeasterly winds developing closer to the surface could lower rainfall amounts, but plenty of moisture will be available for maintaining precipitation for inland locations along higher elevations, including Sterling, Anchorage, Palmer, and Wasilla. Locally heavier rainfall rates will be possible within stronger rain bands. Prolonged rainfall could cause localized flooding on small streams. The exact rainfall totals may change. For more information and for your local forecast, please visit weather.gov/anchorage.
